Package commands

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CommandInterface<T>
    CommandInterface is the interface which defines the structure of all commands, their constants and how to access them, and the method run to run them.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ChangeDirectory
    Change directory to DIR, which may be relative to the current directory or may be a full path.
    ClientUrl
    Takes a url and then creates a file in the current directory containing the contents of the file at the given url
    Command
    Command is the super class which defines the structure of all commands, their constants and how to access them, and the method run to run them.
    Concatenate
    Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Concatenate command.
    Copy
    Makes a copy of a file or directory
    Echo
    Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Echo command.
    Exit
    Quit the program.
    History
    Access the History data of the current session of the java shell and print it out.
    ListContents
    Lists the contents of the current or given directory(s).
    LoadJShell
    Loads a .ser save such that the full state of the shell is loaded into an empty JShell.
    MakeDirectory
    This command takes in two arguments only.
    Manual
    Takes in an array of tokens from execution and executes the Manual command.
    Move
    Move moves a file or directory to the desired location
    PopDirectory
    Allows user to get the most recent directory from the stack, pop it, and change directory into it.
    PrintWorkingDirectory
    Print the current working directory (including the whole path).
    PushDirectory
    Allows user to push current directory to directory stack and change directories to a directory they give.
    Redirection
    Takes in an array of tokens and redirects output to a file.
    Remove
    Removes a directory from the filesystem
    SaveJShell
    Saves the full state of the shell in a .ser file that can be loaded in an empty JShell.
    Search
    Searches through a list of given directories and their sub-directories and then outputs whether the list directories contain the desired file or not
    Tree
    Tree displays the FileSystem as a tree structure
